p: This is the largest dicot family, with approximately 25,000 species worldwide, and includes trees, shrubs, succulents, herbs, and vines, among others. This group is especially diverse in arid regions and Mediterranean-like climates and rarer in tropical rainforests. Among the most significant crop species are sunflower, lettuce, artichokes, and chicory. Many species are used as medicinal herbs (e.g., Achillea spp.) and insect deterrents ( Tanacetum coccineum).
